item.title: Korean War Vet Survives Typhoon Before War
item.description: Korean War veteran Burley Smith recounts surviving a deadly typhoon en route to battle. A gripping story of courage, luck, and resilience.

media:content.media:title: Korean War Vet Survives Typhoon Before War
media:content.media:description: Korean War veteran Burley Smith recounts surviving a deadly typhoon en route to battle. A gripping story of courage, luck, and resilience.

item.title: Losing Oxygen at 18,000 Feet in an Aircraft!
item.description: Experience the harrowing moment of losing oxygen at 18,000 feet. See how quick thinking and training made the difference in this high-altitude emergency.

item.title: My Greatest WWII Achievement
item.description: A WWII veteran shares the moment they are most proud of from the war. Hear a heartfelt story of bravery, sacrifice, and lasting impact.

item.title: Why Water Is Vital in Combat
item.description: Discover why water is the most crucial resource in combat. Learn how staying hydrated can mean the difference between survival and danger on the battlefield.

item.title: WWII Medic Jacob Ruser: How Rain Saved Him
item.description: WWII combat medic Jacob Ruser shares how unexpected rain saved his life. A powerful firsthand story of survival, luck, and wartime courage.

item.title: My Unthinkable 9/11 Mission: Flight 93
item.description: Hear the powerful story of an unthinkable mission on 9/11 involving Flight 93. A firsthand account of the decisions, weight, and reality of that day.

item.title: Unbelievable Song Our Tankers Listened To
item.description: Discover the surprising song that kept our tankers motivated in combat. Hear the unexpected tune that boosted morale on the battlefield.

item.title: Why the Japanese Would Rather Die Than Surrender
item.description: Explains the mindset and military culture in WWII that led many Japanese soldiers to choose death over surrender, examining beliefs, training, and battlefield realities.

item.title: Vietnam Vet vs WWII Vet: The Difference
item.description: Exploring the unique experiences and challenges faced by Vietnam and WWII veterans, highlighting differences in training, combat, and the impact of their service.

item.title: The One Woman the Taliban Feared Most
item.description: Highlighting the story of a woman whose actions and leadership struck fear in the Taliban, showcasing bravery, strategic impact, and historic significance in combat.

item.title: Gene Simmons Explains His Mother’s Survival
item.description: Gene Simmons shares the one key reason his mother survived Nazi concentration camps, providing a powerful and personal insight into resilience and survival.

item.title: “Angel of Death”: AC-130’s First Female Navigator
item.description: 1st Lt. Allison Black, the first female AC-130 navigator, guided precision strikes during ODA 595’s mission in Afghanistan after 9/11, earning the nickname “Angel of Death.”

item.title: US Soldier Speaks on ISIS Attack in Afghanistan
item.description: A firsthand account from a US soldier detailing experiences during an ISIS attack in Afghanistan, sharing insights, challenges, and the realities of combat.

item.title: Lt. Gen. Marc H. Sasseville: 113th Wing Commander
item.description: Lt. General Marc H. Sasseville served as acting operations group commander of the 113th Wing, D.C. Air National Guard, sharing insights on leadership and military operations.

item.title: Dealing with a Japanese Sniper on Tarawa
item.description: A firsthand account of confronting a Japanese sniper during the Battle of Tarawa, showing tactics, challenges, and the intense combat experience faced by Marines.

item.title: The Japanese Would Rather Die Than Surrender
item.description: An account of Japanese military culture in WWII, explaining their mindset, fierce resistance, and the extreme measures taken to avoid surrender.

item.title: What the Germans Fed Us as POWs
item.description: A firsthand account of life as a POW in WWII, detailing the food and rations provided by the Germans and the hardships endured during captivity.

item.title: Colonel Ed Shames: Joining WWII Against the Odds
item.description: Colonel Edward “Ed” Shames, last surviving officer of Easy Company, shares how he forged his mother’s signature to enlist and fight in WWII, recounting bravery and determination.

item.title: Medal of Honor Vet Ralph Puckett Jr. Story
item.description: Korean War Medal of Honor recipient Ralph Puckett Jr. recounts how two of his men saved him despite his orders to abandon him, sharing bravery and loyalty in combat.

item.title: Landing a Helicopter in a Minefield
item.description: A tense and skillful helicopter landing in a minefield, showing pilot techniques, precision, and the high-stakes challenges of navigating dangerous terrain.
